    A conversation with [BazB], [BigLug], [pfaut], and [tye] last week yielded some interesting ideas about improving the SDC. But these ideas will need to be implemented by [pmdev], so we should get our ducks in a row before asking for fun new features.

    SDC nodelet.

    Functionality will depend on the rest of the feature requests. So why do I mention this first? So that you will think about the rest of these feature requests while visualizing instant access to them through the SDC nodelet.

    SDC Scratchpads

    A second scratchpad for each SDC member, visible only to those who can see the SDC wikis ([pmdev], [gods], [powerusers], [SDC], hackers ...), which we could use to write new docs, or rewrite existing docs. This would free the normal scratchpad for it's traditional use - scratching.

    CVS

    We are creating our own control systems, but a true revision control system would provide ease of change, a central repository of who's doing what to which, a record of what's been done, and a history of the changes.

    Now, back to the SDC nodelet. Imagine being able to select what to put there - open docs (linked to CVS), recently changed docs, links to SDC pads which have been updated in the last N days, your current doc projects, etc. The nodelet could be user-configurable, or have set capabilities, depending on what [pmdev] can do.

    [SDC] vs [Site Documentation Clan]
    This is a personal addition. Five characters vs 25 - could we have [SDC] link to [Site Documentation Clan]? Typing that long thing in a CB box is especially fun. :)
